thread.title: Canadiens fire Michel Therrien, name Claude Julien coach
thread.title_full: Canadiens fire Michel Therrien, name Claude Julien coach

author: USA TODAY
title: Canadiens fire Michel Therrien, name Claude Julien coach
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Canadiens fire Michel Therrien, name Claude Julien coach It's the second time the franchise has made this move. Post to Facebook Canadiens fire Michel Therrien, name Claude Julien coach It's the second time the franchise has made this move. Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/2lhen5f Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Canadiens fire Michel Therrien, name Claude Julien coach Mike Coppinger , USA TODAY 4:55 p.m. ET Feb. 14, 2017 Claude Julien coached the Boston Bruins for nearly 10 seasons. (Photo: Steve Mitchell, Steve Mitchell-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
It's Groundhog Day all over again in Montreal. 
Even though the Canadiens sit atop the Atlantic Division, they have gone 1-5-1 in February. And apparently the prospect of Claude Julien manning the bench was too good to pass up -- again. 
The Habs shocked the hockey world Tuesday with the announcement they fired head coach Michel Therrien and subsequently hired Julien, the coach who was fired by the Boston Bruins six days ago. 
This is the second time Therrien was fired by the Canadiens in-season and replaced by Julien. Montreal made the same move in January 2003, when Julien was the coach of their American Hockey League affiliate. 
Terms of the deal were not disclosed. 
"I would like to sincerely thank Michel for his relentless work with the Montreal Canadiens over his eight seasons behind the bench, including the last five seasons when we worked together," Canadiens general manager, Marc Bergevin said in a prepared statement. "The decision to remove Michel from his coaching duties was a difficult one because I have lots of respect for him. I came to the conclusion that our team needed a new energy, a new voice, a new direction. 
"Claude Julien is an experienced and well-respected coach with a good knowledge of the Montreal market. Claude has been very successful as an NHL coach and he won the Stanley Cup. Today we hired the best available coach, and one of the league's best. I am convinced that he has the capabilities to get our team back on the winning track." Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Feb. 13: Flames forward Garnet Hathaway (64) and Coyotes goalie Mike Smith (41) collide during the third period at Scotiabank Saddledome. The Capitals won 6-4.
